verses.text: If thou wilt return , O Israel , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, return unto me: and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight , then shalt thou not remove.
And thou shalt swear , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth , in truth , in judgment , and in righteousness ; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory. \p
¶ For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to the men of Judah and Jerusalem , Break up your fallow ground , and sow not among thorns.

Circumcise yourselves to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and take away the foreskins of your heart , ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem : lest my fury come forth like fire , and burn that none can quench \add it\add*, because of the evil of your doings. \p
Declare ye in Judah , and publish in Jerusalem ; and say , Blow ye the trumpet in the land : cry , gather together , and say , Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the defenced cities.

Set up the standard toward Zion : retire , stay not: for I will bring evil from the north , and a great destruction.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft retire: or, strengthen\f*\f + \fr 4.6 \ft destruction: Heb. breaking\f*

The lion is come up from his thicket , and the destroyer of the Gentiles is on his way ; he is gone forth from his place to make thy land desolate ; \add and\add* thy cities shall be laid waste , without an inhabitant.
For this gird you with sackcloth , lament and howl : for the fierce anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is not turned back from us.

And it shall come to pass at that day , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add that\add* the heart of the king shall perish , and the heart of the princes ; and the priests shall be astonished , and the prophets shall wonder.
Then said I, Ah , Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem , saying , Ye shall have peace ; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.
At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem , A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people , not to fan , nor to cleanse ,

\add Even\add* a full wind from those \add places\add* shall come unto me: now also will I give sentence against them.\f + \fr 4.12 \ft a full…: or, a fuller wind than those\f*\f + \fr 4.12 \ft give…: Heb. utter judgments\f*
Behold, he shall come up as clouds , and his chariots \add shall be\add* as a whirlwind : his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are spoiled.
O Jerusalem , wash thine heart from wickedness , that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thy vain thoughts lodge within thee?
For a voice declareth from Dan , and publisheth affliction from mount Ephraim.
Make ye mention to the nations ; behold, publish against Jerusalem , \add that\add* watchers come from a far country , and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.
As keepers of a field , are they against her round about ; because she hath been rebellious against me, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Thy way and thy doings have procured these \add things\add* unto thee; this \add is\add* thy wickedness , because it is bitter , because it reacheth unto thine heart. \p

¶ My bowels , my bowels ! I am pained at my very heart ; my heart maketh a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace , because thou hast heard , O my soul , the sound of the trumpet , the alarm of war.\f + \fr 4.19 \ft my very…: Heb. the walls of my heart\f*
Destruction upon destruction is cried ; for the whole land is spoiled : suddenly are my tents spoiled , \add and\add* my curtains in a moment.
How long shall I see the standard , \add and\add* hear the sound of the trumpet ?

For my people \add is\add* foolish , they have not known me; they \add are\add* sottish children , and they have none understanding : they \add are\add* wise to do evil , but to do good they have no knowledge.
I beheld the earth , and, lo, \add it was\add* without form , and void ; and the heavens , and they \add had\add* no light.
I beheld the mountains , and, lo, they trembled , and all the hills moved lightly.
I beheld , and, lo, \add there was\add* no man , and all the birds of the heavens were fled.

I beheld , and, lo, the fruitful place \add was\add* a wilderness , and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add and\add* by his fierce anger.
For thus hath the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , The whole land shall be desolate ; yet will I not make a full end.
For this shall the earth mourn , and the heavens above be black : because I have spoken \add it\add*, I have purposed \add it\add*, and will not repent , neither will I turn back from it.
The whole city shall flee for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen ; they shall go into thickets , and climb up upon the rocks : every city \add shall be\add* forsaken , and not a man dwell therein.

And \add when\add* thou \add art\add* spoiled , what wilt thou do ? Though thou clothest thyself with crimson , though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold , though thou rentest thy face with painting , in vain shalt thou make thyself fair ; \add thy\add* lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.\f + \fr 4.30 \ft face: Heb. eyes\f*

For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail , \add and\add* the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child , the voice of the daughter of Zion , \add that\add* bewaileth herself, \add that\add* spreadeth her hands , \add saying\add*, Woe \add is\add* me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.
